medical_history.chief_complaint: Substernal and right upper quadrant pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began four days prior to admission, starting with severe constipation, abdominal distention, and sharp intermittent substernal pain. Pain worsened over four days, reaching peak severity on the afternoon of admission. The patient has not taken any medications for pain relief. The patient also experienced intermittent fevers around 100.9 F and polyuria, voiding small volumes multiple times a day. Loss of appetite has been noted.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hodgkin's lymphoma status post chemotherapy and radiation to left groin; left groin biopsy; history of port-a-cath.
medical_history.family_history: Mother and maternal grandfather with history of lower extremity lymphedema.
